info.description:
Before using this API, we recommend you read our **[Authorization Guide](https://developers.amadeus.com/self-service/apis-docs/guides/authorization-262)** for more information on how to generate an access token. 

Please also be aware that our test environment is based on a subset of the production, this API in test only offers 24 hotels; 10 in London and 14 in New-York. You can find the list in our **[data collection](https://github.com/amadeus4dev/data-collection)**.
info.title: Hotel Ratings

code.description: A machine-readable error code from the Amadeus Canned Messages table, that will enable the API Consumers code to handle this type of error

detail.description: An easy-to-read explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. It should give the API consumer an idea of what went wrong and how to recover from it. Like the title, this field’s value can be localized.

documentation.description: A link to a web page or file with further documentation to help the API consumer resolve this error

example.description: A sample input to guide the user when resolving this issue

parameter.description: The key of the URI path or query parameter that caused the error

pointer.description: A JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request body that caused this error

status.description: The [HTTP status code](https://www.iana.org/assignments/http-status-codes/http-status-codes.xhtml) of this response. This is present only in terminal errors which cause an unsuccessful response. In the case of multiple errors, they must all have the same status.

title.description: An error title from the Canned Messages table with a 1:1 correspondence to the error code. This may be localized

warnings.detail: Some of the requested properties were not found in our database.
warnings.title: PROPERTIES NOT FOUND

hotelId.description: Amadeus Hotel Ids are found in the Hotel Search response (parameter name is 'hotelId')

overallRating.description: Integer between 0 and 100. It represents the score for a specific category or the overall rating for a given Hotel.

sentiments.description: Dictionary containing scores for all the available categories.  If a property does not have any category this object will not be present in the response.

catering.description: Integer between 0 and 100. It represents the score for a specific category or the overall rating for a given Hotel.

facilities.description: Integer between 0 and 100. It represents the score for a specific category or the overall rating for a given Hotel.

internet.description: Integer between 0 and 100. It represents the score for a specific category or the overall rating for a given Hotel.

location.description: Integer between 0 and 100. It represents the score for a specific category or the overall rating for a given Hotel.

pointsOfInterest.description: Integer between 0 and 100. It represents the score for a specific category or the overall rating for a given Hotel.

roomComforts.description: Integer between 0 and 100. It represents the score for a specific category or the overall rating for a given Hotel.

service.description: Integer between 0 and 100. It represents the score for a specific category or the overall rating for a given Hotel.

sleepQuality.description: Integer between 0 and 100. It represents the score for a specific category or the overall rating for a given Hotel.

staff.description: Integer between 0 and 100. It represents the score for a specific category or the overall rating for a given Hotel.

swimmingPool.description: Integer between 0 and 100. It represents the score for a specific category or the overall rating for a given Hotel.

valueForMoney.description: Integer between 0 and 100. It represents the score for a specific category or the overall rating for a given Hotel.
